page.title: 08Industry comes to Strelley
page.content: "In 1980{Strelley Hall}was unoccupied since the death of Emily Mary Edge, the last of the Edge family who had occupied the property for 330 years. Before that the Strelley family had owned the estate since 1198. The main building was in a bad state of repair, needing considerable attention. It was situated in most attractive parkland and PAFEC Ltd decided it would make an attractive headquarters for the growing international company. At Â£165,000 it was expensive for the company so I sold my own house and moved into part of the building. There are a few problems with this arrangement: it is not possible to relax at weekends and holiday times. But the buildings and surroundings are a great source of enjoyment to our family." Richard Henshell MD PAFEC
